Chemistry is the science of watered down physics

1:25 Love is more than hormones. You cannot find the property of love at the molecular level. Of course, love has a CORRESPONDENT hormonal activity, but that does not mean that love=hormones. Just like the reactive metal Na and the toxic gas Cl combine to give the life-sustaining NaCl, so does different physiological processes combine to give the feeling of love. You cannot find the property of love at the molecular level, just as you cannot find the life-sustaining property for chlorine gas, for instance. Parts do not necessarily entail the same properties for the whole they create and vice-versa. So, love is more than hormones, it's an emergent entity upon certain physiological processes, having new and different properties than the parts that make it possible.
